meanings.definition: Not in good health; sick or ill.
meanings.sent1: She felt unhealths after eating too much junk food.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed medicine for her unhealths condition.
meanings.sent3: His unhealths appearance in the mirror made him realize he needed to exercise more.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead cast an unhealths shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The unhealths smell coming from the garbage made her hold her nose.

meanings.definition: The state of being unwell or unhealthy.
meanings.sent1: His constant coughing was a sign of his unhealths.
meanings.sent2: The hospital was filled with patients suffering from various unhealths.
meanings.sent3: The unhealths of the old building was evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent4: The unhealths of the economy was causing concern among the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The unhealths of the river was a result of pollution from nearby factories.

meanings.definition: To cause harm or damage to one's health.
meanings.sent1: Smoking can unhealths your lungs over time.
meanings.sent2: Eating too much sugar can unhealths your teeth.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said that staying up late unhealths his beauty sleep.
meanings.sent4: The stress of work unhealths his mental well-being.
